result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes

records.addlTxt: Court ORDERS Defendant turned over to Justice Point with Level 5 Supervision. The Court ordered defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  The Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. The Court ordered defendant to undergo random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. No possession of firearms or dangerous weapons. No Contact with Jose Sostre.

Defendant Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes in court.  Attorney Michael Reyes in court for Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Spanish Interpreter sworn: Reme Bashi

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing. Parties wish to proceed with Plea hearing, and set adjourned date for Sentencing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ORDER Defendant turned over to Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision, with conditions, pending sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 9 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
/filed.
records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

Defendant Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes in court.  Attorney Michael Reyes in court for Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Spanish Interpreter sworn: Brenda Bartholomew.

Case in court for Plea hearing.  Court advised new offer from the State received.  Offer placed on the record.  Defense requests additional time to review and requests adjourned Plea and Sentencing hearing be set.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Email sent to Natalie Nguygen for one Spanish Interpreter for Plea hearing set for 9/9/2022 at 9 am

Defendant Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Spanish Interpreter Sworn: Brenda Bartholomew (appears via zoom).

Case in court for continued Pretrial Conference.  Defense has received discovery from the State and is reviewing with Defendant. Defense requests Plea hearing date.
Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Patrick Ryan sworn in. Court sets 07/01/2022 as a deadline for parties to confirm that all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, to be turned over to Defense. Court sets 08/03/2022 as the deadline to file any motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes in court with Attorney Michael Reyes.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholowmew. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL2 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
 IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jesus Miguel Diaz Reyes in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For purposes of this hearing Spanish Interpreter has been WAIVED. Attorney Reyes will be translating for his client. Attorney Reyes is a certified spanish interpreter. Defendant will need a Spanish Interpreter at the next court appearance.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
